content.raw: will the `BuildNormalizedDeviceCoordinatesMatrix` function be used anywhere else?

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
Initially i implemented [BuildNormalizedDeviceCoordinatesMatrix and BuildPerspectiveMatrix](https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/GLSL_Programming/Vertex_Transformations) in order to compute the [opengl projective matrix](http://ksimek.github.io/2013/06/03/calibrated_cameras_in_opengl/).
Later on i optimized the matrix multiplication projectiveMatrix = NDCMatrix*PerspectiveMatrix in order to reduce the computation cost and also to use doubles instead of floats ([Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/_ogre_matrix4_8h_source.html) uses floats).

I kept both mainly for documentation (because the initial implementation is easier to understand) and also because they might be useful in other gazebo code (but in that case they probably should go into a math or utils class / namespace).

But if you think they should be removed i will delete them (keeping only the BuildProjectiveMatrix).
content.html:
Initially i implemented BuildNormalizedDeviceCoordinatesMatrix and BuildPerspectiveMatrix in order to compute the opengl projective matrix. Later on i optimized the matrix multiplication projectiveMatrix = NDCMatrix*PerspectiveMatrix in order to reduce the computation cost and also to use doubles instead of floats (Ogre::Matrix4 uses floats).

I kept both mainly for documentation (because the initial implementation is easier to understand) and also because they might be useful in other gazebo code (but in that case they probably should go into a math or utils class / namespace).

But if you think they should be removed i will delete them (keeping only the BuildProjectiveMatrix).

content.raw:
I think the functions are useful but we tend not to leave unused code in the main development branch so we would probably need to remove them for the time being.

It'll be nice to document what you did here with some comments and that should be sufficient.
content.html:
I think the functions are useful but we tend not to leave unused code in the main development branch so we would probably need to remove them for the time being.

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
Given that the main reason for the shorter version was to avoid the float multiplications from [Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/_ogre_matrix4_8h_source.html) (i am using ignition::math::Matrix4d double matrix now), i think its best to keep the extended implementation since it is easier to understand and maintain.
Please check last commit.
content.html: Given that the main reason for the shorter version was to avoid the float multiplications from Ogre::Matrix4 (i am using ignition::math::Matrix4d double matrix now), i think its best to keep the extended implementation since it is easier to understand and maintain. Please check last commit.

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
I used [Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_matrix4.html) because [setCustomProjectionMatrix](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_frustum.html#a0413e366f2b5ecaac7e8a1e27e634def) requires a [Ogre::Matrix4](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_matrix4.html) object.

Moving to [ignition::math::Matrix4d](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Matrix4.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) in the header would require a conversion before every [setCustomProjectionMatrix](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_frustum.html#a0413e366f2b5ecaac7e8a1e27e634def) call.

And it seems that [ignition::math::Matrix4d](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/99a6af105c966541bba583ce84bf467ec5057890/include/ignition/math/Matrix4.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) doesn't have a function to convert between these two matrix types. So it would need to be done inline or with a new conversion function (which would add the Ogre matrix to the header).

How do you want me to proceed?
content.html:
I used Ogre::Matrix4 because setCustomProjectionMatrix requires a Ogre::Matrix4 object.

Moving to ignition::math::Matrix4d in the header would require a conversion before every setCustomProjectionMatrix call.

And it seems that ignition::math::Matrix4d doesn't have a function to convert between these two matrix types. So it would need to be done inline or with a new conversion function (which would add the Ogre matrix to the header).

How do you want me to proceed?

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
we have a [Conversions](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9326d816744bd252d424688468e740e561895fc1/gazebo/rendering/Conversions.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) class with static functions for this. Currently it doesn't a function to convert between Matrix4 types. You could add something like:

~~~
public: static Ogre::Matrix4 Convert(const ignition::math::Matrix4d &_matrix);
~~~
content.html:
we have a Conversions class with static functions for this. Currently it doesn't a function to convert between Matrix4 types. You could add something like:

public: static Ogre::Matrix4 Convert(const ignition::math::Matrix4d &_matrix);

content.raw: \+1 Just wanted to bump this \(I can resolve conflicts if original author would not like to\). Would be very convient for simulating robot’s cameras which have been calibrated and have known intrinsics. It is currently difficult / complicated to simulate ROS code using image/projection geometry with gazebo.

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
Good afternoon :slight_smile: 

I can resolve the conflicts, no problem \(from time to time I sync this fork with the gazebo master while waiting for feedback / integration of this pull request\).

Simulating the intrinsics of the cameras also has other applications besides testing vision systems.

Namely projection of information into the environment with high accuracy.

Example for the cooperative assembly of a car engine:

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWQuF1o5Z9Y](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWQuF1o5Z9Y)

Have a nice day :\)

‌

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
For using the image\_proc it is necessary to fill the camera info with the intrinsics and distortion parameters:

* [https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo\_projection\_mapping/blob/hydro-devel/worlds/camera\_intrinsics.world#L107](https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping/blob/hydro-devel/worlds/camera_intrinsics.world#L107)

For that I created a pull request for gazebo\_ros\_pkgs \(adding support for fx and fy, the rest were already implemented\):

* [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/pull/374](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/374)

‌
content.html:
For using the image_proc it is necessary to fill the camera info with the intrinsics and distortion parameters:

  • https://github.com/inesc-tec-robotics/gazebo_projection_mapping/blob/hydro-devel/worlds/camera_intrinsics.world#L107

For that I created a pull request for gazebo_ros_pkgs (adding support for fx and fy, the rest were already implemented):

  • https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/374

‌

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.html:
Here’re some very minor coding style changes. Could you apply this patch?

diff -r abb20f3a0c28 gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc
--- a/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc        Thu Jul 12 00:44:27 2018 +0100
+++ b/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc        Tue Jan 15 17:06:04 2019 -0800
@@ -191,7 +191,7 @@
     this->dataPtr->distortion->Load(this->sdf->GetElement("distortion"));
   }

-  LoadCameraIntrinsics();
+  this->LoadCameraIntrinsics();
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
@@ -203,7 +203,7 @@
     if (sdfLens->HasElement("intrinsics"))
     {
       sdf::ElementPtr sdfIntrinsics = sdfLens->GetElement("intrinsics");
-      UpdateCameraIntrinsics(
+      this->UpdateCameraIntrinsics(
           sdfIntrinsics->Get<double>("fx"),
           sdfIntrinsics->Get<double>("fy"),
           sdfIntrinsics->Get<double>("cx"),
@@ -229,15 +229,17 @@
     clipFar = clipElem->Get<double>("far");
   }

-  this->cameraProjectiveMatrix = BuildProjectiveMatrix(
+  this->cameraProjectiveMatrix = this->BuildProjectiveMatrix(
     this->imageWidth, this->imageHeight,
     _cameraIntrinsicsFx, _cameraIntrinsicsFy,
     _cameraIntrinsicsCx, _cameraIntrinsicsCy,
     _cameraIntrinsicsS, clipNear, clipFar);

-  if (this->camera != NULL)
+  if (this->camera != nullptr)
+  {
     this->camera->setCustomProjectionMatrix(true,
         Conversions::Convert(cameraProjectiveMatrix));
+  }

   this->cameraUsingIntrinsics = true;
 }
@@ -305,9 +307,9 @@
     const double _intrinsicsS,
     const double _clipNear, const double _clipFar)
 {
-  return BuildNDCMatrix(
+  return this->BuildNDCMatrix(
            0, _imageWidth, 0, _imageHeight, _clipNear, _clipFar) *
-         BuildPerspectiveMatrix(
+         this->BuildPerspectiveMatrix(
            _intrinsicsFx, _intrinsicsFy, _intrinsicsCx, _intrinsicsCy,
            _intrinsicsS, _clipNear, _clipFar);
 }

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
`BuildNDCMatrix`and `BuildPerspectiveMatrix` are static functions.

Should I use:  
\+  return Camera::BuildNDCMatrix\(  
            0, \_imageWidth, 0, \_imageHeight, \_clipNear, \_clipFar\) \*  
-         BuildPerspectiveMatrix\(  
\+         Camera::BuildPerspectiveMatrix\(  
            \_intrinsicsFx, \_intrinsicsFy, \_intrinsicsCx, \_intrinsicsCy,  
            \_intrinsicsS, \_clipNear, \_clipFar\);
content.html:
BuildNDCMatrixand BuildPerspectiveMatrix are static functions.

Should I use:
+ return Camera::BuildNDCMatrix(
0, _imageWidth, 0, _imageHeight, _clipNear, _clipFar) *
- BuildPerspectiveMatrix(
+ Camera::BuildPerspectiveMatrix(
_intrinsicsFx, _intrinsicsFy, _intrinsicsCx, _intrinsicsCy,
_intrinsicsS, _clipNear, _clipFar);

Indeed I am using `UpdateCameraIntrinsics`in a plugin for dynamically updating the parameters from a CameraInfo msg:  
[https://github.com/carlosmccosta/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel-gz10/gazebo\_plugins/src/gazebo\_ros\_camera\_utils.cpp#L437](https://github.com/carlosmccosta/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel-gz10/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_camera_utils.cpp#L437)

But I can change `LoadCameraIntrinsics` to private if needed.
content.html:
Indeed I am using UpdateCameraIntrinsicsin a plugin for dynamically updating the parameters from a CameraInfo msg:
https://github.com/carlosmccosta/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel-gz10/gazebo_plugins/src/gazebo_ros_camera_utils.cpp#L437

pullrequest.title: Added camera intrinsics (fx, fy, cx, cy, s).

content.raw:
For future reference, I discussed the modeling of camera intrinsics in opengl in this paper:

“Modeling of video projectors in OpenGL for implementing a spatial augmented reality teaching system for assembly operations”

[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332083524\_Modeling\_of\_video\_projectors\_in\_OpenGL\_for\_implementing\_a\_spatial\_augmented\_reality\_teaching\_system\_for\_assembly\_operations](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332083524_Modeling_of_video_projectors_in_OpenGL_for_implementing_a_spatial_augmented_reality_teaching_system_for_assembly_operations)
content.html:
For future reference, I discussed the modeling of camera intrinsics in opengl in this paper:

“Modeling of video projectors in OpenGL for implementing a spatial augmented reality teaching system for assembly operations”

https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332083524_Modeling_of_video_projectors_in_OpenGL_for_implementing_a_spatial_augmented_reality_teaching_system_for_assembly_operations
